timeline.bodyText: I don't think a sudo belongs here. This is karaf command line, not bash.
timeline.author: GanimanSwift
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -4,24 +4,25 @@
 .Configure systemd to start Minion on system boot
 [source, shell]
 ----
-systemctl enable minion
+sudo systemctl enable minion
 ----
 
 .Start up Minion
 [source, shell]
 ----
-systemctl start minion
+sudo systemctl start minion
 ----
 
 .Test access to Karaf shell with user `admin` and password `admin` and configure the Minion
 [source, shell]
+[subs=+quotes]
 ----
 ssh -p 8201 admin@localhost
 
 config:edit org.opennms.minion.controller
-config:property-set location #Office-Pittsboro
-config:property-set http-url #http://opennms-fqdn:8980/opennms
-config:property-set broker-url failover:#tcp://opennms-fqdn:61616
+config:property-set location [red]#Office-Pittsboro#
+sudo config:property-set http-url [red]#http://opennms-fqdn:8980/opennms#

timeline.bodyText: I think "username" should be one word everywhere. It is one argument of this karaf command, not two, so I think having it as "user name" is incorrect.
timeline.author: GanimanSwift
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -30,9 +31,10 @@ TIP: Include the `failover:` portion of the broker URL to allow the Minion to re
 
 .Configure the credentials to use when communicating with {opennms-product-name} and exit Karaf shell
 [source]
+[subs=+quotes]
 ----
-opennms:scv-set opennms.http #minion user name minion password
-opennms:scv-set opennms.broker #minion username minion password
+opennms:scv-set opennms.http [red]#minion user name minion password#
